intro: Stigmaphyllon saxicola, commonly known as the rock stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to the rocky regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often on limestone or rocky substrates. Stigmaphyllon saxicola is adapted to withstand drought and nutrient-poor soils, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
